StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: Determinants of Asthma Following RSV Bronchiolitis in Early Life

Policy.acknowledgement_statement:
The suggested Acknowledgement Statement to accompany the dataset is:
The authors would like to thank the children and families that graciously provided their time and effort to participate in the RBEL Study.
This research was funded by grants from (R01 HL092486, R01 HL061895, UL1 RR024992-01, R01 ES015794, R01 HL088133, T32 GM007546, R01 HL004464, and R01 HL104608), the National Institute On Minority Health And Health Disparities (P60 MD006902), the Alan A. and Edith L. Wolff Chair in Pulmonary and Critical Care Medicine, the Flight Attendant Medical Research Institute (www.famri.org), the Sandler Foundation (www.sandlerfoundation.org), and the American Asthma Foundation (www.americanasthmafoundation.org).
Policy.ic_specific_access_term: Use of the data must be related to Allergy, Asthma, and Respiratory. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Use of the data is limited only by the terms of the model Data Use Certification.

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Unrestricted access (institution responded that the study is not sensitive without submitting a new Institutional Certification)

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Allergy, Asthma, and Respiratory, IRB)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-AAR-IRB
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Allergy, Asthma, and Respiratory. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval.
